content.title: Sastraposhini Scheme
content.department: Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE)
content.details: Sastraposhini is a programme envisaged by the Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE) for strengthening science education in schools of Kerala. Under the programme, model science laboratories are established in selected Government high schools of the State to provide a better learning environment. The programme was launched by KSCSTE in association with the Department of Education, Government of Kerala in the year 2003. So far, KSCSTE has successfully established more than 200 science laboratories throughout Kerala. Presently, KSCSTE has decided to implement the scheme only in government high schools of Kerala.
benefits: A total of ₹8 lakhs is spent to establish Sastraposhini laboratories (Physics, Chemistry, and Biology) in one school with a fair share from KSCSTE.
Training will be provided to selected teachers from Sastraposhini schools by eminent scholars/ academicians from different disciplines.
Laboratory manuals and visual experimental aids and models will be provided to the selected schools.

Training programme for teachers: Two teachers each in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology from Sastraposhini schools are invited to participate in a training programme. The trained teachers will be in charge of each laboratory.
eligibility: Only government high schools in the State with sufficient facilities (three rooms to establish Physics, Chemistry, and Biology laboratories), and qualified faculty in science are eligible.

The schools applying for the scheme shall have the following basic requirements: sufficient space to establish Sastraposhini laboratories (separate rooms for physics, chemistry, and biology laboratories), qualified teachers in three subject areas (physics, chemistry, and biology), sufficient number of students in the high school section, extend of administrative support from the Headmaster/Principal/Management for the smooth implementation of the scheme.
documents_required: Name and details of the teacher to be nominated as in charge of the laboratory
Remarkable achievements of the school, if any
Details of the nearest Sastraposhini School
Official bank account details of the school
Declaration by the head of the institution

faqs.question: What is the “Sastraposhini”?
faqs.answer: Sastraposhini is a programme envisaged by the Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE) for strengthening science education in schools of Kerala.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the programme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the programme is to stimulate interest in experimental science, provide an opportunity for self-learning, encourage novel science projects from students, provide advanced training to teachers to cope-up with the latest teaching skills using laboratory experiments & design low-cost laboratory kits.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this programme?
faqs.answer: Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE)

faqs.question: When was this programme launched?
faqs.answer: The programme was launched by KSCSTE in association with the Department of Education, Government of Kerala in the year 2003.

faqs.question: Can only government high schools be eligible to apply for the programme?
faqs.answer: Yes, only government high schools in the State with sufficient facilities (three rooms to establish Physics, Chemistry, and Biology laboratories) are eligible to apply under the programme.

faqs.question: What are the basic requirements that shall have the schools which are applying under the programme?
faqs.answer: The schools applying for the scheme shall have the basic requirements such as sufficient space to establish Sastraposhini laboratories (separate rooms for physics, chemistry, and biology laboratories), qualified teachers in three subject areas (physics, chemistry, and biology), sufficient number of students in the high school section and extend of administrative support from the Headmaster/Principal/Management for the smooth implementation of the scheme.

faqs.question: How much amount to be spent to establish Sastraposhini laboratories in a school?
faqs.answer: A total of ₹8 lakhs is spent to establish Sastraposhini laboratories (Physics, Chemistry, and Biology) in one school.

faqs.question: Which subject teachers are eligible for training under the programme?
faqs.answer: Two teachers each in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology from Sastraposhini schools are invited to participate in a training programme.

faqs.question: When will the applications be invited for the programme?
faqs.answer: Applications are invited in the month of JULY every year.

faqs.question: How can be applied under the programme?
faqs.answer: The Principal/HM of the school shall apply for the scheme in the prescribed format given on the KSCSTE website and forward it through the Head of the Institution for required financial support.

faqs.question: Where can be submitted the application form?
faqs.answer: The application in the prescribed format should be submitted to: Director, Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment, Sasthra Bhavan, Pattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram - 695004.
